thread.title: Comedian Larry David slays as Bernie Sanders on 'Saturday Night Live'
thread.title_full: Comedian Larry David slays as Bernie Sanders on 'Saturday Night Live'

author: Erin Edgemon | eedgemon@al.com
title: Comedian Larry David slays as Bernie Sanders on 'Saturday Night Live'
text:
Comments 
Comedian Larry David made a triumphant return to "Saturday Night Live" impersonating Democratic candidate for president Bernie Sanders in last night's opening sketch. 
"I'm going to dial it right up to a ten. We're doomed! We need a revolution! We've got millions of people in the streets. We gotta do something and we gotta do it now," David said as Sen. Sanders of Vermont, participating in a mock version of the recent Democratic debate. 
David mostly sparred against Kate McKinnon's Hillary Clinton. Alec Baldwin made a notable appearance as Jim Webb, former U.S. senator from Virginia. 
In the hilarious 10-minute sketch, David gave a spot-on impression of Sanders, hunching his shoulders and talking with his hands. 
David's biggest laugh came at the end when he said: "I'm Bernie Sanders and come next November, I will be Hillary Clinton's vice president!" 
David served as a SNL writer for a year in the mid-1980s. He is most known for co-creating "Seinfeld" and "Curb Your Enthusiasm."
